title: Republicans and Democrats deliver final pitches on election eve
description: Republicans and Democrats traded final blows Monday ahead of midterm elections that could upend Joe Biden's presidency, weaken Western support for Ukraine and even open the door to a comeback bid by Donald Trump.

title: MEP Hervé Juvin convicted of domestic violence, dismissed by far-right Rassemblement National
description: The member of the European Parliament was convicted on appeal in October. The party says it was never aware of his initial conviction a year ago.

title: US midterms: Over 42 million early votes cast, surpassing 2018 numbers
description: American citizens have flocked to vote early, a practice that became widespread during the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Germany's Scholz warns against fossil fuel 'renaissance'
description: Olaf Scholz issued the warning during a speech at COP27, asserting Germany would not fall back on fossil fuels amid an energy crisis caused by a lack of Russian energy imports.

title: War in Ukraine: Hope and fear live side by side in Crimea
description: Annexed in 2014 and turned into a showcase by Moscow, the Crimean peninsula now increasingly resembles a front line, but its residents consider a return to the hands of Ukraine highly unlikely.

title: The making of 'Pamfir': 'Our post-production studio was in a war zone'
description: Ukrainian and French producers Aleksandra Kostina and Laura Briand tell 'Le Monde' about the difficulties making Dmytro Sukholytkyy-Sobchuk's first feature film.

title: At least 15,000 killed by hot weather in Europe in 2022, says WHO
description: Spain and Germany were among the worst affected by the hot weather in 2022, according to the international public health organization.

title: Musk says US voters should back Republicans in US midterms
description: Elon Musk, days after taking control of social media site Twitter, encouraged his 114 million followers to vote Republican, just one day before the US' midterm elections.

title: Three Egyptian journalists go on hunger strike to free dissident
description: Alaa Abdel Fattah – serving a five-year sentence for 'broadcasting false news' – has been on hunger strike for seven months and stopped drinking water on Sunday.

title: Sunak holds first meeting with Macron, seeking migrant co-operation
description: Rishi Sunak and Emmanuel Macron met on the sidelines of the COP27 climate summit in Egypt.

title: COP27: Thorny issue of 'loss and damage' added to official agenda for first time
description: The countries most vulnerable to the effects of climate change have been calling for compensation from the world's biggest polluters for years. For the first time, this year's COP27 includes funding arrangements for 'loss and damage' caused by climate change.

title: Eleven French bishops accused of sexual abuse
description: As the clergy meets to discuss transparency regarding historic sex crimes, the Bishops' Conference of France has announced the accused will face prosecution or church disciplinary procedures.

title: Despite forming a new government, Iraq's political system is marked by dysfunction and corruption
description: After more than a year of political deadlock, Iraq has approved a new government, marking the Shiite's return to power.

title: Murder of Lola: What the investigation on suspect Dahbia Benkired reveals
description: The young woman suspected of killing the 12-year-old child in Paris in mid-October had been in France since 2014. In a police interview, her sister described her as a 'bad seed' and 'bipolar.'

title: COP27: 'Choose climate solidarity or collective suicide,' UN chief warns world leaders
description: Speaking at the climate conference in Egypt, Antonio Guterres urged wealthy countries to step up their efforts on behalf of emerging economies in the face of climate extremes.

title: French far-right MP who made racist comment was elected to party council, but quietly withdrew
description: The lawmaker who was suspended for a 'go back to Africa' outburst at the Assemblée Nationale withdrew from a Rassemblement National council, and it was not announced that party members had elected him.

title: Gates Foundation announces $1.4 billion climate grant at COP27 to help small-scale farmers
description: The grant, announced during the COP27 conference in Sharm el-Sheikh, will help smallholder farmers in sub-Saharan Africa and South Asia to improve food security in the face of climate change.

title: Wounded whale washes ashore in northern France
description: A wounded whale was found on a beach in northern France on Monday. Local authorities described the discovery as 'exceptional.'

title: Ukrainian counter-offensive in Kherson meets entrenched Russian army
description: One of Ukraine's declared goals is to push back Russia in the Kherson region, but some analysts question whether Moscow is undertaking a 'deception' operation.

title: French firm Vinci expects to be charged over Qatar building sites
description: Vinci said its subsidiary was expected to be charged this week but denied using forced labour and taking part in human trafficking.

title: PSG draws Bayern in Champions League last 16, as Liverpool rematch Real Madrid
description: The first leg will take place in February 2023 and the return in March.

title: COP27: Agriculture and food are neglected in climate negotiations
description: Only 3% of public funding for climate change is allocated to agriculture and food, even though this sector accounts for one-third of greenhouse gas emissions

title: US midterms: The disturbing metamorphosis of election night
description: 'The US midterm elections as seen from my French window': Whether the results come quickly and clearly or are dragged out and contested, this election is as unprecedented as it is unpredictable.

title: COP27: South Africa, a testing ground for a 'just energy transition'
description: At COP27, the country highly dependent on coal will explain how it wants to use the $8.5 billion promised by rich countries to help it decarbonize its energy.

title: Champs-Elysées becomes a building site ahead of 2024 Olympic Games
description: With nearly a dozen construction sites, the French capital's most celebrated avenue is in disarray, while rent reaches record levels as tourists return post-pandemic.

title: Macron urges US and China to pay fair share to tackle climate change
description: The French president told activists that while European countries are paying to help developing countries deal with climate events, other wealthy nations must do more.

title: 'The 2024 Paris Olympics could lead to a summer without festivals'
description: The deployment of police and gendarmes during the Olympic Games could hamper the organization or duration of cultural events in the summer of 2024, writes 'Le Monde' editor-in-chief Michel Guerrin.

title: 2022 World Cup: Qatar's foreign minister denounces 'hypocrisy of attacks'
description: In an interview with 'Le Monde', Qatar's Foreign Minister Mohammed ben Abderrahmane Al-Thani defends his country against criticisms over the World Cup.

title: French hotel and restaurant bosses support a residence permit for 'in-demand jobs'
description: The government's plan to regularize undocumented workers is welcomed by this sector, which has been facing serious recruitment difficulties and a lack of attractiveness since the pandemic.

title: In Switzerland, Sanija Ameti is fighting to revive a rapprochement with the EU
description: Very critical of her country's isolationist retreat, this Green party representative heads the progressive movement Operation Libero, which aims to reopen talks with Brussels.

title: US Republicans and the school of democratic regression
description: The Claremont Institute, a thoroughly right-wing think tank on the West Coast, is becoming more radical and its ideas are circulating without sounding alarm bells in intellectual circles.

title: Antonio Guterres, the UN chief passionately fighting against 'climate carnage'
description: Since taking office in January 2017, the UN secretary-general has constantly hammered home, in increasingly incendiary speeches, the urgency to act in this 'battle for our lives.'

title: Amnesty International warns Egypt, current hosts of COP27, has days to save jailed activist's life
description: While pushing for the immediate release of jailed dissident Alaa Abdel Fattah, the international NGO is looking to use COP27 to push for action on human rights issues related to climate change.

title: Apple warns iPhone production disrupted by Covid restrictions at Foxconn factory
description: Despite strong demand for Apple's products ahead of the holiday season, "customers will experience longer wait times to receive their new products".

title: Turkish opposition figures serve as bargaining chips in talks for Sweden's NATO membership
description: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan is calling for the extradition of several human rights activists and journalists in exchange for agreement that the Nordic country be allowed to join the North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO).

title: Climate conferences are sounding boards for the world's debates
description: For nearly 30 years, these annual conferences have brought together delegations from 196 nations, along with civil society and global media, as part of an overall objective to accelerate the fight against climate change. But do they achieve anything?

title: Meta to announce plan to layoff 'thousands' of employees this week
description: The latest plans from Facebook-parent Meta follow recent announcements by other tech firms to freeze hiring or cut their workforce as the industry fights economic headwinds.

title: Qatar 2022: the World Cup's promise of 'carbon neutrality' lacks credibility
description: As the world grapples with the urgency of the climate crisis, FIFA and Qatar's organizing committee have tried to sell the tournament as being 'carbon neutral', their arguments fail to convince.
